reviews.text: Simply put!... this place was dump. I stayed here for two days on a school trip and I was appalled at what I encountered in such a short stay. The rooms were extremely cold as was the temperature inside the rest of the hotel. I already had a cold and the environment didn’t help one bit. The bathroom walls were moldy and the water from the faucet was filthy. The beds where infested with bedbugs and when I requested a new room the hotel staff simply told me to sleep in the lobby. The food there is beyond appetizing and the staff is totally ill-mannered. Not to mention the 70's theme of the hotel. I recommend this hotel to no one in their right mind. Shut this place down!!!
reviews.title: Simply put...dump!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a teenager, my family and I had stayed at Kutsher's for about 8 years in a row - my mother, father, brother and I. This, however, was 15 years ago. My brother and I wanted to do something for New Year's Eve this year that required no airline tickets to get there. He came up with the idea of going to Kutsher's that New Year's Eve weekend, and reliving the memories from our childhood. We booked 2 rooms for four of us (my brother, his gf, me, and my bf). It cost us $130 a night for each room. This included meals, not tips or drinks. We also needed to make a $200 deposit for the two rooms. But the total price didn't sound too shabby, since meals were included. We also wanted to go skiing and there were mountains nearby. My mother kept warning me that the place would disappoint us, and we shouldn't go there. Of course, being children, we need to do it anyway and hopefully prove our parents wrong. About 2 days before, I went online to get directions there, and I came upon reviews on tripadvisor.com. OMG! I'd say that EVERY single review had MANY negative things to say. This made me nervous and I expressed it to the ones I was going with. However, at that point, we couldn't get our deposit back, because it was over the 72 hour threshold you need to cancel by. Ok, so how bad could it be? Well, my brother informed me that he switched rooms 3 times, before I got there! The heat wasn't working in the first room. The second room's door locks seemed shady, so he didn't feel comfortable, and then finally got an upgrade to the third room. I was given the upgrade to my room as well. Let me just say that when I looked at this "upgraded" room, I couldn't even imagine what a nonupgraded room would look like! It didn't look like it was cleaned, the ambiance of the room was from the 1970's, the shower had mildew everywhere, there was brown gunk coming out of the faucet when turned on, the cover to the heater was off....I could go on and on. I felt like I was in a shelter for my vacation. Then we excitedly left the room to get something to eat in the dining room. I don't know what they killed or what kind of cheap crap was served, but it was disgusting. Juice was included, and when we received our juice, it came in cups the size of shot glasses. The entertainment that night was a comedian, and he was terrible. Even better, the main reason why we went upstate in New York was for skiing and it was so warm that NO mountains had any snow! NONE! What were we gonna do for 3 days with no skiing? Needless to say, the next morning, skipping breakfast, we left, went to a diner, and had to make last minute plans for the rest of the New Year's Eve weekend, including New Year's Eve. My brother ended up getting us a refund of everything except the cost of dinner per person, which was $30. How in the world they came up with $30, I will never have any idea. It wasn't even worth a few dollars. AND! What's really interesting is that there were apparently 900 people staying there that weekend. I'd like to know what they saw that we didn't. I certainly didn't remember Kutsher's like this as a teenager. At that time, I wanted to keep going back there year after year, until my mother couldn't take the fact that it was so boring there, so we stopped going. After that experience, my mind has definitely changed. As my review title states...KUTSHER'S COULDN'T PAY ME TO STAY THERE AGAIN!!!
reviews.title: Kutsher's couldn't pay me to stay there again!!!

reviews.text: I was at Kutsher's during the December 2006 break. I had a great time due to the wonderful service, entertainment, and food. I'll definitely be back. The room's furniture was a little old, but how much time do you spend in your room?
reviews.title: Wonderful time

reviews.text: This was...well let me try to describe it. The hotel is if not, then one of the last of its kind. I recently went to honor my grandmother...Well, I get into the hotel, and there is a polka convention. I thought, wow this hotel must be pretty popular. The desk took FOREVER to check us in. We got to the room...The room had no...remote or clock. Our sofa had been crushed. I will admit the size of the room was nice, but the housekeeping was....less than unsatisfactory.
reviews.title: Excruciating

likes.liked: — The Ice Rink, but aside from that...Leaving

reviews.text: I decided "Lets go swimming, can someone screw up a swimming pool?" My brother and I got dressed in our bathing suits. We got down to the swimming pool, their bar was adjacent to it and named "The Deep End" . The thing was...This bar was on the shallow end of the pool. Once I got over the cognitive dissonance of this fact I entered the pool room. The room was 9 MILLION DEGREES AND STIFLING!!! THE AIR WASN'T SO MUCH A GAS AS A LIQUID!!! THE POOL WAS MISSING 2 FEET OF WATER.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel for the sake of your health

reviews.text: Don't even know where to begin on this..this place is absolutely mold-infested, and should be razed to the ground. Unfortunately, I was there for a music conference and didn't have the option of going anywhere else, so I muscled my way through a one-night stay and got out of there as fast as I could the following morning. More details:
reviews.title: Awful, awful, AWFUL
Won't be going back to Kutsher's
reviews.text: Mold infestation is so apparent that not only can you smell it as soon as you enter the place, you can SEE it: there was black mold growing in my bathroom. . That's REALLY bad.

The bathroom light was a flurescent lamp that was so old it a) made the entire bathroom green; b) flickered so incessantly that it PAINFUL to be in the bathroom for more than 5 seconds. The water coming out of both the sink and the shower was brown. Had to brush my teeth with bottled water and didn't even shower in the morning
reviews.title: On a scale of 1 - 10 this rated minus 3

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was institutional and terrible. I had better food in high school. The silverware was rusty and old, and the dining room staff was rude and inattentive.
reviews.title: Revolting
worst than bad
reviews.text: On top of it all, at the end of my stay, I noticed on my bill that they had the nerve to charge my credit card $9.00 on an $80.oo room rate. That ended poorly for them, that's for sure.

We have been coming here for years. If you have kids from ages 4 - 15, the hotel offers a camp. It is run by Lenny and Sherry. They are good people and keep the kids entertained with the help of teenage counselors. What is neat about this is it allows the parents some time to just relax.
reviews.title: Depends on your expectations

reviews.text: The food is still good. It is Kosher, and there is plenty of it. You can really stuff yourself so watch out. The dinning room hall is nice and clean and the staff is real nice, friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Terrible hotel , Wow
kutshers
reviews.text: The rooms are dated. Some have a mill dew. Bring a can of disinfectant. We bring it to high class hotels also. I always think it is a good idea where-ever you go. The beds are hit an miss. At place like this you have to look pass certain things.
There are a lot of a older people. Most are nice and friendly. Many love seeing kids. Remember not to long from now we will be one of them.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

likes.liked: — I thought it was a great value
likes.disliked: — It's not easy to get to if you are out of the NE area

reviews.title: Revisiting Great Memories
reviews.text: The golf course is top notch and very reasonably priced. The vistas and views from the course are gorgeous. We took the kids out on the course and they saw a deer and an owl. And we just marveled at the views. The course can play tough or easy depending where you tee off from. I would say it is slightly more challenging than the Blue at Bethpage. You have to take an electric golf cart or you will die walking up the hills.

This resort is the last of its breed and I am sorry to say that it has seen it's best days along time ago. There used to be Grossinger's, The Concord, Brown's, etc-all the borscht belt all -inclusive Jewish resorts. Kutsher's is it if this is the type of experience you seek, but our experience was very disappointing. The place is smelly, moldy and loaded with safety violations-some inspectors must be getting their palms greased big-time to ignore some of the stuff we saw. The food is ok-wait staff are trying their best. Most other staff are ok, but some are really lack in basic customer service skills. The Catskill area is beautiful in all seasons, and we lucked out with mostly good weather, but our first day was horrifically hot. Kutsher's a/c system was not working well at all and out of 8 rooms we booked, we had to relocate 5, which took at least three hours. A mistake was made in an amount quoted on one of the rooms-no apologies, desk staff just rudely told me I should have known a price was wrong and that is how it was (?) Very little for kids to do. We will not be going back. All in all, it was good to be with family for the reunion, but we were all in agreement that we would never go back to Kutcher's unless a major investment ws made to overhaul the resort. Very, very sad......
reviews.title: Dying a slow painful death

likes.disliked: — The facility is a total disaster

reviews.title: Hotel and Golf Course are excellent and very pleasing to all ages
reviews.text: This hotel is excellent and interesting for all ages. it can be very good for a family reunion or family vacation. it has a golf course, indoor pool, outdoor pool, minature golf cousre , many restaurants, shuffle board, bocce ball, raquet ball. ice skating, day camp, park, teen center, and an entertainmanet theather with shows and perfromances like singers like The Drifters or stand up comedy like Dale Grand. even though it is kind of old it is still very great. the waiters are very kind and good with kids and the whole family. thats why i would rate kutsher's hoteal and golf course 5 out of 5 stars.

I came to Kutsher's for the first time during April 2006, and I have been very disappointed. The guest rooms are shabby at best, and there are no bathmats or hand towels provided. The windows won't open, and the air vents don't work. Most of the equipment in their exercise room is broken. The people at the front desk claim that they will help, but they do nothing. The only person who has been pleasant and helpful is our waiter Vanil, who is a doll. The lobby is nice enough, and there is a lovely music room, but these are the only really attractive areas in the hotel.
reviews.title: Very disappointing, a shandeh!
It's seen better days
reviews.text: I am staying here with my 89-year-old mother, and I must say that this is NOT the place for an older person who has mobility issues. The hotel is very spread out, with lots of unecessary stairs to climb and descend, no railing along the long corriders, and no one to help an elderly person find his or her way around.
The doors to the guest rooms are so heavy that even an able-bodied person has trouble opening them! I won't be coming back to this place.
